RPGXplorerObject.Name: Name is one of 'Craft (Alchemy), Craft (Armorsmithing), Craft (Artist), Craft (Baking), Craft (Basketweaving), Craft (Blacksmithing), Craft (Bowmaking), Craft (Candlemaking), Craft (Carpentry), Craft (Cobbling), Craft (Fletching), Craft (Glassblowing), Craft (Gunsmithing), Craft (Herbalism), Craft (Jewelcraft), Craft (Leatherwork), Craft (Locksmithing), Craft (Papermaking), Craft (Pottery), Craft (Ropemaking), Craft (Stonemasonry), Craft (Tailoring), Craft (Thatching), Craft (Trapmaking), Craft (Weaponsmithing), Craft (Weaving)'

Name is one of 'Appraise, Balance, Bluff, Climb, Concentration, Decipher Script, Diplomacy, Disable Device, Disguise, Escape Artist, Forgery, Gather Information, Handle Animal, Heal, Hide, Intimidate, Jump, Listen, Move Silently, Open Lock, Ride, Search, Sense Motive, Sleight of Hand, Speak Language, Spellcraft, Spot, Survival, Swim, Tumble, Use Magic Device, Use Rope'
Turn or Rebuke Undead
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Channel positive (or negative) energy to turn away (or awe) undead.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Aid Another
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Grant an ally a +2 bonus on attacks or AC.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Bull Rush
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Push an opponent back 5 feet or more.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Charge
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Move up to twice your speed and attack with +2 bonus.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Disarm
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Knock a weapon from your opponent’s hands.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Feint
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Negate your opponent’s Dex bonus to AC.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Grapple
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Wrestle with an opponent

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Mounted Combat
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Rules for mounted combat.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Overrun
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Plow past or over an opponent as you move.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Sunder
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Strike an opponent’s weapon or shield.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Throw Splash Weapon
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Throw container of dangerous liquid at target,

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Trip
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Trip an opponent.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Two-Weapon Fighting
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Fight with a weapon in each hand.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Attacks of Opportunity
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Rules for attacks of opportunity.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Combat Round
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Each round represents 6 seconds.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Shooting or Throwing into a Melee
RPGXplorerObject.HTML: UserDocs\Shooting or Throwing into a Melee.htm

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Ability Score Loss
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Ability score damage or drain.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Antimagic
RPGXplorerObject.Description: An anitmagic field spell or effect cancels magic altogether.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Blindsight and Blindsense
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The extraordinary ability to use a nonvisual sense to operater effectively without vision.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Breath Weapon
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Expelling something from the mouth that is harmful.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Charm and Compulsion
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Abilities and spells that affect the mind.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Cold Immunity
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A creature with cold immunity never takes cold damage.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Damage Reduction
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The supernatural ability to instantly heal damage from weapons or to ignore it altogether.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Darkvision
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The extraordinary ability to see with no light source at all.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Death Attacks
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Allows the victim a Fortitude save but if failed, the character dies instantly.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Disease
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A damaging contamination of the body contracted through contact, inhalation, ingestion or injury.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Energy Drain and Negative Levels
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The fearsome supernatural ability to drain character levels.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Etherealness
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Creatures who exist on the Ethereal Plane.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Evasion and Improved Evasion
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Allow the target of an attack to leap or twist out of the way.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Fast Healing
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The extraordinary ability to regain hit points at an exceptional rate.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Fear
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Spells, magic items and certain monsters can affect characters with fear.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Fire Immunity
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A creature with fire immunity never takes fire damage.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Gaseous Form
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The supernatural or spell-like ability to take the form of a cloud of vapor or gas.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Gaze Attacks
RPGXplorerObject.Description: An attack that is delivered by making eye-contact with the victim.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Incorporeality
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Incorporeal creatures lack a physical body and cannot be touched by non-magical matter or energy.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Invisibility
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Cannot be seen.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Level Loss
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The loss of one or more character levels.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Low-Light Vision
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Can see twice as far as normal in dim light.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Paralysis
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A paralyzed character cannot move, speak or take any physical action.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Poison
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A damaging contamination of the body contracted through contact, inhalation, ingestion or injury.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Polymorph
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The ability to change your own or someone else's shape.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Psionics
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Telepathy, mental combat and psychic powers.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Rays
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A ray of magical energy.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Regeneration
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Extraordinary ability to recover from wounds quickly and regrow or reattach severed body parts.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Resistance to Energy
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Ignore some of the damage dealt by a specific form of energy.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Scent
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Detect approaching enemies, sniff out hidden foes and track by sense of smell.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Spell Resistance
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The extraordinary ability to avoid being affected by spells.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Tremorsense
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A creature with tremorsense automatically senses the location of anything that is in contact with the ground and within range.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Turn Resistance
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Some creatures are less easily affected by the turning ability of clerics or paladins.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Ability Damaged
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character has temporarily lost 1 or more ability score points.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Ability Drained
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character has permanently lost 1 or more ability score points.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Blinded
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character cannot see.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Blown Away
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Depending on size, a creature can be blown away by winds of high velocity.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Checked
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Prevented from achieving forward motion by an applied force, such as wind.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Confused
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A confused character's actions are determined by rolling a d100 at the beginning of this turn.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Cowering
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character is frozen in fear and can take no actions.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Dazed
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The creature is unable to act normally.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Dazzled
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Unable to see because of overstimulation of the eyes.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Dead
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Hit points are reduced to -10, Constitution to 0 or killed outright by a spell or effect.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Deafened
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A deafened character cannot hear.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Disabled
RPGXplorerObject.Description: 0 hit points or one who has negative hit points but has become stable and conscious.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Dying
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Unconscious and near death with between -1 and -9 hit points.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Energy Drained
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character gains one or more negative levels which might become permanent.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Entangled
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character is ensnared and movement is impeded.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Exhausted
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Extremely tired through physical exertion.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Fascinated
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A fascinated creature is entranced by a supernatural or spell effect.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Fatigued
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Very tired through physical exertion.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Flat-footed
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A character who has been surprised and has not yet reacted fully to the situation.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Frightened
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A frightened creature flees from the source of its fear as best it can.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Grappling
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Engaged in wrestling or some other form of hand-to-hand struggle with one or more attackers.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Helpless
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Paralyzed, held, bound, sleeping, unconscious or otherwise completely at an opponent's mercy.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Incorporeal
RPGXplorerObject.Description: No physical body.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Invisible
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Visually undetectable.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Knocked Down
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Creatures can be knocked down by winds of high velocity.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Nauseated
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Experiencing stomach distress.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Panicked
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Must drop anything it holds and flee from the source of its fear.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Paralyzed
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A paralyzed character is frozen in place and unable to move or act.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Petrified
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Turned to stone and considered unconscious.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Pinned
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Held immobile (but not helpless) in a grapple.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Prone
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The character is on the ground.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Shaken
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Somewhat fearful.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Sickened
RPGXplorerObject.Description: No definition provided in SRD.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Stable
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Was dying, has negative hit points but has stopped losing hit points.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Staggered
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A character whose nonlethal damage exactly equals his current hit points.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Stunned
RPGXplorerObject.Description: A stunned creature drops everything held and can't take actions.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Turned
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Affected by a turn undead attempt.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Unconscious
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Knocked out and helpless.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Delay
RPGXplorerObject.Description: By choosing to delay, you take no action and then act normally on whatever initiative count you decide to act.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Ready
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The ready action lets you prepare to take an action later, after your turn is over but before your next one has begun.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Action Types
RPGXplorerObject.Description: The different actions you can take in a round.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Name doesn't contain 'Craft' or 'Perform' or 'Profession' or 'Knowledge'
Leadership
RPGXplorerObject.Description: You can attract loyal companions and devoted followers.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Divination
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Provides useful advice for specific proposed actions.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Read Magic
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Read scrolls and spellbooks.
RPGXplorerObject.ClassLevels: Brd 0, Clr 0, Drd 0, Pal 1, Rgr 1, Sor 0, Wiz 0

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Identify
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Determines properties of magic item.

RPGXplorerObject.Name: Dispel Magic
RPGXplorerObject.Description: Cancels spells and magical effects.
RPGXplorerObject.ClassLevels: Brd 3, Clr 3, Drd 4, Magic 3, Pal 3, Sor 3, Wiz 3
RPGXplorerObject.TargetAreaEffect: Area Dispel: When dispel magic is used in this way, the spell affects everything within a 20-foot radius.
